metadata.synopsis: Main Wulbren dialog in gnomes hideout cellar of a smithy in Rivington. Wulbren should give player a quest to destroy Gondian workshop.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go tolarian://bookmark?mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-256.842865;4.010455;-1075.743286&camTarget=-257.499420;3.498121;-1076.296875You'll get a trespassing dialog, click through it. Then talk to Wulbren

74.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
74.text: So - are you with me? Ready to take down the Steel Watch?
74.context: NodeContext: Keen to inspire the player to join his cause

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I've been to the Foundry - the Gondians are prisoners.

67.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
67.text: Prisoners can lay down their tools.

2.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
2.text: The Gondians are making weapons for a tyrant - that makes them the enemy.

140.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
140.text: Destroy their factory, for the sake of the city.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: I'll shut down production, but not using your methods.

17.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
17.text: I'm running out of patience. Friend.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Yes - but not using your methods.

83.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
83.text: Careful - lots of open flames down here. Don't want that bomb close to any of them. What is it?
83.context: NodeContext: Concerned due to the player carrying a highly dangerous explosive

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Are you sure this is the only way?

147.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
147.text: I wouldn't have asked you if it wasn't, friend.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Remind me what to do with the bomb.

105.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
105.text: Keep your head down, get to the Lower City, and find the foundry down by the docks.

19.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
19.text: Getting inside won't be easy, but when you do, place the bomb at the heart of the facility, get yourself back to street level.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Nothing - I'll be heading to the foundry soon.

57.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
57.text: Good. I'd wish you luck, but I know you won't need it.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I don't have the bomb anymore.

109.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
109.text: Bloody fool. That bomb was one-of-a-kind - I trusted you with it because you know what's at stake.

142.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
142.text: Find another way to take the foundry down, or kiss Baldur's Gate goodbye.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: The Fist want you dead - I offered to help.

102.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
102.text: Good to see you. Wasn't sure you'd make it to the city. Regretting it yet?
102.context: NodeContext: rothéshit = shit of a rothé = ROW-thay-shit

107.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
107.text: I spent a lot of time thinking of worst case scenarios while I was locked in that cell you plucked me out of at Moonrise.
107.context: NodeContext: rothéshit = shit of a rothé = ROW-thay-shit

148.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
148.text: I didn't imagine anything as bad as this. The Gondians have handed Enver Gortash the means to bring about the end of liberty in Baldur's Gate.
148.context: NodeContext: rothéshit = shit of a rothé = ROW-thay-shit

98.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
98.text: And the citizens have rolled out the red carpet for their new tyrant.
98.context: NodeContext: rothéshit = shit of a rothé = ROW-thay-shit

132.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
132.text: Resistance fighters are few and far between - my Ironhands, what's left of the Harpers, and you. I hope.
132.context: NodeContext: rothéshit = shit of a rothé = ROW-thay-shit

141.speaker: Player
141.context: NodeContext: rothéshit = shit of a rothé = ROW-thay-shit

120.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
120.text: Good. We don't have a chance unless we stick together - not while the Gondians' metal monsters are patrolling the streets.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Gortash is a dead man - I have reasons of my own for taking him down.
18.context: NodeContext: rothéshit = shit of a rothé = ROW-thay-shit

47.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
47.text: As long as our objective is the same, the reason doesn't matter to me. We have a common enemy.

80.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
80.text: But neither of us gets what we want until we deal with our biggest obstacle.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: This is your fight - not mine.
8.context: NodeContext: rothéshit = shit of a rothé = ROW-thay-shit

55.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
55.text: You almost sound convinced by your own rothéshit.
55.context: NodeContext: rothéshit = shit of a rothé = ROW-thay-shit

20.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
20.text: Whatever brought you to the city, you won't get anywhere while the Gondians' metal monsters are patrolling the streets.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

15.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
15.text: The Steel Watch. They're a threat to you, me - and every man, woman and child in the city.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

45.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
45.text: They act all civilised... servants of the people. But they only serve one man.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

137.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
137.text: When he becomes Grand Duke, it will only get worse. Laws will change, freedoms will vanish, and soon you'll be accused and sentenced before you've even committed a crime.
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

9.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
9.text: And the fucking Gondians are to blame for all of it.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Cheer up Wulbren. We're here to help.
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

129.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
129.text: I heard about that. You had the Harpers all excited, but there aren't many Harpers left.

60.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
60.text: These Steel Watchers. One of them is the equivalent of a red dragon. An army of them, well... there's never been an army of dragons.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I'm not scared of dragons. Or Steel Watchers.

71.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
71.text: There's a line where bravery becomes stupidity. You just crossed it.

56.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
56.text: Scared or not, you can't take down every Steel Watcher in the city. Unless you hit the people who build them - the Gondians.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'm sneaky - I'll keep clear of them.

3.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
3.text: They'll find you, and they'll kill you.

40.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
40.text: We need to stop them, and there's only one way to do it.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I'm not quite an army of dragons, but I'm the closest thing you'll probably find.

38.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
38.text: Even a mountain of magic wouldn't be enough to stop those behemoths. No, there's only one way of stopping the Steel Watch.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Personally, I put a lot of the blame on Gortash.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

111.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
111.text: A tyrant's nothing without lackeys. And the Gondians are the perfect lackeys. Dangerously intelligent, pathetically submissive.
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

85.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
85.text: They invented the Steel Watchers. And they're building an army of them.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

114.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
114.text: They've always been happy to provide their technology to despots in exchange for a stipend and the freedom to work in peace.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

76.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
76.text: They would have licked Sarevok's boots given the chance, and now they'll kiss Gortash's ring while the city screams.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

108.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
108.text: I had a plan to put a stop to them. But the way things are now, if we stick our heads above ground, the Watchers are on us like flies on shit.
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

146.speaker: Player
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

118.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
118.text: Same as it always is. Eliminate the threat.

154.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
154.text: In this case - the foundry where these atrocities are produced.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: The city's not exactly safe for me either.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

53.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
53.text: Neither was Moonrise, and look how that turned out. You have a knack for passing among these bastards as if you were one of them.

21.speaker: Player
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I've already run foul of the Watchers myself.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

54.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
54.text: And yet here you are, all in one piece. Most people who cross them aren't much more than a stain on the street afterwards.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

72.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
72.text: You can do what's needed - I'm sure of it.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

42.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
42.text: You just need a little assistance, and I can provide it.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

7.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
7.text: The Gondians are ingenious. But we're more than equal to them - there's nothing they can build that the Ironhands can't tear down.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

151.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
151.text: I've built something unique for just that purpose.
151.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

13.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
13.text: A runepowder bomb - first of its kind. Fifty wizards high on the Weave couldn't summon this kind of firepower.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

130.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
130.text: Get the bomb inside the Gondian facility, and - boom. Problem solved.
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

75.speaker: Barcus Wroot
75.text: Wulbren, please. This is too far! Everyone in the foundry would be killed.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

138.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
138.text: Quiet, Barcus. The adults are talking.
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Give me the bomb. I'll make sure nobody survives - guard, Gondian, or passerby.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Barcus has a point - this sounds like mass murder.
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

37.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

27.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
27.text: The Gondians picked their side the minute they took orders from Gortash.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

89.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
89.text: If they had any courage, they'd have refused him and died like heroes, spitting in his face.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

135.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
135.text: Now they'll die like the dogs they are.
135.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Gortash is the enemy - not the Gondians. I'll find another way.
126.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Collateral damage is the best way to tie up loose ends. Give me the bomb.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

63.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
63.text: I knew you were the practical sort. That's why we get along.

1.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
1.text: The foundry is in the Lower City, down by the docks. Beautiful building, belching smoke into the sky day and night.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I'm convinced - give me the bomb, and I'll take out the foundry.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I'll make contact with the Gondians - maybe they'll see reason.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

32.speaker: Barcus Wroot
32.text: That's what I've been saying! There may yet be a peaceful solution.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

4.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
4.text: Fine. You want to try flapping your gums in the belly of the beast, be my guest.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: dismissive gesture, he's disgusted with us and our attempts to befriend the enemy

113.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
113.text: But their idea of diplomacy is a steel fist shoved where the sun don't shine.

69.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
69.text: So take the bomb. Just in case I'm right, and you're wrong.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Fine. I'll take it - but I'll only use it as a last resort.

59.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
59.text: As long as you see sense, I don't care when you see it.

44.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
44.text: The streets will be clear of Watchers in no time.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Keep your bomb. I'm doing this my way.

48.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
48.text: My way's the only way - I think you're just too delicate to admit it.

5.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
5.text: But I believe in second chances. When you come crawling back here - and you will - we can talk.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: This is too messy for me - I'm out.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I'll blow up the foundry - give me the bomb.
39.context: NodeContext: fanatical - "exactly" is said in vindication -  "innocents" said in derision, disguist

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Maybe the Gondians are victims, not oppressors.
86.context: NodeContext: fanatical - "exactly" is said in vindication -  "innocents" said in derision, disguist

51.speaker: Player
51.text: You can count on me. I'll put a stop to those mechanised horrors.
51.context: NodeContext: fanatical - "exactly" is said in vindication -  "innocents" said in derision, disguist

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Those metal monsters spit in nature's face, but mass murder is a bit far.
46.context: NodeContext: fanatical - "exactly" is said in vindication -  "innocents" said in derision, disguist

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Killing innocents won't right this wrong, Wulbren.
29.context: NodeContext: fanatical - "exactly" is said in vindication -  "innocents" said in derision, disguist

110.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
110.text: Innocents. You have no idea what you're talking about.
110.context: NodeContext: fanatical - "exactly" is said in vindication -  "innocents" said in derision, disguist

23.speaker: Player
23.text: This plan seems a bit loud for my liking. Messy, too.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: It's going to be quite the explosion - I can't wait.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: No plan survives contact with the enemy - unless I'm involved.

66.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
66.text: Exactly. You freed us from Ketheric's rotten cells - I reckon you can rid us of these Gondians just as easily.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Why put the blame on the Gondians?

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Perhaps the Gondians were infected with a tadpole?

123.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
123.text: Perhaps. All the more reason to get rid of them.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: The Gondians are just inventors. You can't blame them for Gortash's actions.

82.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
82.text: I can blame them for precisely that reason.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Well, maybe you can blame them for that.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I still don't buy it. Would you blame a mage for how the spells they wrote are used?

119.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
119.text: These Gondians are not poor, unknowing mages scribbling spell scrolls for Minute Meteors or Acid Arrows. They are complicit.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: There must be a reason the Gondians would do something so terrible.

70.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
70.text: Could be they're part of the cult. Could just be for coin. Couldn't possibly tell you.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: The Fists sent me to crush your resistance. Time to die.

122.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
122.text: The runepowder bomb was our best chance of crushing the Steel Watch, and you squandered it.

26.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
26.text: Find another way to shut down that foundry, or you might as well slip your head in a noose right now. Gortash will string us all up.
